alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 9:43PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 1015 PM MDT... At 943 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Raton Crews Airport, or 16 miles southwest of Raton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton and Raton Crews Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 444 and 457. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 327 and 354. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
